Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 21 for SLE 12 SP2)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 21 for SLE 12 SP2)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.4.121-92_73 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2018-16884: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's NFS41+ subsystem. NFS41+ shares mounted in different network namespaces at the same time could make bc_svc_process() use wrong back-channel IDs and cause a use-after-free vulnerability. Thus a malicious container user could cause a host kernel memory corruption and a system panic. Due to the nature of the flaw, privilege escalation cannot be fully ruled out (bsc#1119947).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's NFS41+ subsystem. NFS41+ shares mounted in different network namespaces at the same time can make bc_svc_process() use wrong back-channel IDs and cause a use-after-free vulnerability. Thus a malicious container user can cause a host kernel memory corruption and a system panic. Due to the nature of the flaw, privilege escalation cannot be fully ruled out.
